title: Box of beasts
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Type | Miscellaneous item                                                              |
| :--- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | box of beasts                                                                   |
| Icon | [![Box of beasts.png](/images/2/23/Box_of_beasts.png)](/File:Box_of_beasts.png) |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A box filled with the bizarre leftovers of a depraved wizard's magical experimentations. Opening it might set loose a friendly mutant beast: bizarre creatures, each with their own combination of traits. Increased skill with Evocations will allow stronger beasts to be released.There are six known traits:* Bat beasts fly and move very quickly, but erratically.
* Fire beasts resist and breathe fire.
* Ox beasts resist cold, are armoured with thick fur, and can knock back foes.
* Shock beasts resist electricity and can transform into living lightning.
* Sting beasts resist poison and have a reaching poison-tail attack.
* Weird beasts can see invisible and attack with constricting tentacles.As far as anyone knows, all beasts have exactly two of these traits. |

A **box of beasts** is a [miscellaneous magic item](/Evocable_items "Evocable items") which can summon an irregular, albeit friendly, monster, classified generally as a mutant beast.

The box of beasts becomes empty after one use; it can be recharged by gaining experience. Like with other miscellaneous evocables, only 1 box of beasts will spawn in a given game.

## Mutant Beast

A mutant beast usually combines two random traits/facets:

- Bat: [flying](/Flying "Flying"), [fast](/Fast "Fast"), [batty](/Batty "Batty").
- Sting: [reach](/Reaching "Reaching")/[poison](/Poison "Poison"), rPois.
- Fire: [fire breath](/Fire_Breath "Fire Breath"), rF.
- Weird: [constrict](/Constrict "Constrict"), [sInv](/See_invisible "See invisible").
- Shock: rElec, [blinkbolt](/Blinkbolt "Blinkbolt").
- Ox: [trample](/Trample "Trample"), rC, +5 AC.

Each beast also has one of five tiers, corresponding to HD and melee attack damage.

- Larval (HD 3) (12 damage)
- Juvenile (HD 9) (19 damage)
- Mature (HD 15) (26 damage)
- Elder (HD 21) (33 damage)
- Primal (HD 27) (40 damage)

[HD](/HD "HD") of mutant beasts is roughly `(Evocations skill + 1d7 - 1d7)`, rounded up to the nearest tier & capped at 27.

## History

- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), boxes of beasts had a 1/3 chance to fall apart after every use and didn't recharge with XP.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), boxes of beasts didn't stack.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), a box of beasts would instead summon a [chimera](/Chimera "Chimera").
- In [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), box of beasts became considerably stronger than before.
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13") this item summoned individual (non-chimera) monsters.
- Prior to [0.9](/0.9 "0.9"), it appeared as a **small ebony casket** while unidentified.

| Miscellaneous [Evocables](/Evocable "Evocable")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Figurine of a ziggurat](/Figurine_of_a_ziggurat "Figurine of a ziggurat") • [Horn of Geryon](/Horn_of_Geryon "Horn of Geryon") • [Lightning rod](/Lightning_rod "Lightning rod") • [Phantom mirror](/Phantom_mirror "Phantom mirror") [Phial of floods](/Phial_of_floods "Phial of floods") / [Gell's gravitambourine](/Gell%27s_gravitambourine "Gell's gravitambourine") • [Condenser vane](/Condenser_vane "Condenser vane") / [Tin of tremorstones](/Tin_of_tremorstones "Tin of tremorstones") • [Box of beasts]() / [Sack of spiders](/Sack_of_spiders "Sack of spiders") |
html:
Box of beasts

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Type Miscellaneous item
Name box of beasts
Icon
A box filled with the bizarre leftovers of a depraved wizard's magical experimentations. Opening it might set loose a friendly mutant beast: bizarre creatures, each with their own combination of traits. Increased skill with Evocations will allow stronger beasts to be released.


There are six known traits:

  • Bat beasts fly and move very quickly, but erratically.
  • Fire beasts resist and breathe fire.
  • Ox beasts resist cold, are armoured with thick fur, and can knock back foes.
  • Shock beasts resist electricity and can transform into living lightning.
  • Sting beasts resist poison and have a reaching poison-tail attack.
  • Weird beasts can see invisible and attack with constricting tentacles.


As far as anyone knows, all beasts have exactly two of these traits.

A box of beasts is a miscellaneous magic item which can summon an irregular, albeit friendly, monster, classified generally as a mutant beast.

The box of beasts becomes empty after one use; it can be recharged by gaining experience. Like with other miscellaneous evocables, only 1 box of beasts will spawn in a given game.

Mutant Beast

A mutant beast usually combines two random traits/facets:

  • Bat: flying, fast, batty.
  • Sting: reach/poison, rPois.
  • Fire: fire breath, rF.
  • Weird: constrict, sInv.
  • Shock: rElec, blinkbolt.
  • Ox: trample, rC, +5 AC.

Each beast also has one of five tiers, corresponding to HD and melee attack damage.

  • Larval (HD 3) (12 damage)
  • Juvenile (HD 9) (19 damage)
  • Mature (HD 15) (26 damage)
  • Elder (HD 21) (33 damage)
  • Primal (HD 27) (40 damage)

HD of mutant beasts is roughly (Evocations skill + 1d7 - 1d7), rounded up to the nearest tier & capped at 27.

History

  • Prior to 0.26, boxes of beasts had a 1/3 chance to fall apart after every use and didn't recharge with XP.
  • Prior to 0.19, boxes of beasts didn't stack.
  • Prior to 0.17, a box of beasts would instead summon a chimera.
  • In 0.16, box of beasts became considerably stronger than before.
  • Prior to 0.13 this item summoned individual (non-chimera) monsters.
  • Prior to 0.9, it appeared as a small ebony casket while unidentified.
Miscellaneous Evocables
Figurine of a ziggurat • Horn of Geryon • Lightning rod • Phantom mirror
Phial of floods / Gell's gravitambourine • Condenser vane / Tin of tremorstones • Box of beasts / Sack of spiders
